briefTitle: Study to Assess Functionality, Reliability, and Performance of a Pre-filled Syringe With Benralizumab Administered at Home
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Open-Label, Functionality, Reliability, and Performance Study of an Accessorized Pre-filled Syringe With Home-administered Subcutaneous Benralizumab in Adult Patients With Severe Asthma (GREGALE)
summary: The purpose of the study is to assess functionality, performance, and reliability of an accessorized pre-filled syringe (APFS) with benralizumab administered subcutaneously (SC) in an at-home setting reported by the patient or caregiver, and to confirm the safety and clinical benefit of benralizumab administration in asthma patients with severe asthma.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Patients/Caregivers Who Successfully Administered Benralizumab 30 mg Subcutaneously (SC) by Injection With an APFS at Home
